content.raw:
I can think of two ways the resolution param could define the first pass image size: Based on the number of samples (size = resolution * samples) or based on the field of view (size = resolution * fov), e.g. 5 pixels per degree or so. 
The first option is probably closer to the semantics of that param in the CPU version. On the other hand the second option makes it easier to control the size of the area (pixel in first pass image) that is averaged to get the range for one ray which in theory is only a point.

One thing that also needs to be fixed: Currently the case of only 1 vertical ray does not seem to work. I will take a look at it the next days.
